name: Caucasian Music
description: Music of the region of the Caucasus, a mountainous region bordered by Russia to the north and Turkey/Iran to the south, with the Black and Caspian seas to its sides.

children.name: Caucasian Folk Music
children.description: Folk of the Caucasus region, a mountainous area that connects Eastern Europe to Asia.

children.name: Caucasian Folk Music
children.description: Folk of the Caucasus region, a mountainous area that connects Eastern Europe to Asia.

children.name: Karachay-Balkarian Music
children.description: Music of the Karachay and Balkar peoples of the Northwestern Caucasus, who reside in the republics of Karachay-Cherkessia and Kabardino-Balkaria.

children.name: Karachay-Balkarian Music
children.description: Music of the Karachay and Balkar peoples of the Northwestern Caucasus, who reside in the republics of Karachay-Cherkessia and Kabardino-Balkaria.

children.name: Rabiz
children.description: Elements of Armenian folk in its instrumentation, oftentimes incorporating influences from Arabic and other West Asian forms on a background of synthesizer arrangements.
